00036 /* AUTO_SPARC_HACK added by John Walker.  If defined, USE_FLOAT_MUL   
00037    automatically set when compiling on a Sparc.  This lets most
00038    people avoid editing the Makefile. */
00039 
00040 #ifdef AUTO_SPARC_HACK
00041 #ifdef sparc
00042 #define USE_FLOAT_MUL
00043 #define FAST
00044 #endif
00045 #endif

00047 /*
00048  *      Interface
00049  */
00050 
00051 typedef struct gsm_state *      gsm;
00052 typedef short                   gsm_signal;             /* signed 16 bit */
00053 typedef unsigned char           gsm_byte;
00054 typedef gsm_byte                gsm_frame[33];          /* 33 * 8 bits   */
00055 
00056 #define GSM_MAGIC       0xD                             /* 13 kbit/s RPE-LTP */
00057 
00058 #define GSM_PATCHLEVEL  2
00059 #define GSM_MINOR       0
00060 #define GSM_MAJOR       1
00061 
00062 #define GSM_OPT_VERBOSE 1
00063 #define GSM_OPT_FAST    2
00064 
00065 extern gsm  gsm_create  GSM_P((void));
00066 extern void gsm_destroy GSM_P((gsm));   
00067 
00068 extern int  gsm_print   GSM_P((FILE *, gsm, gsm_byte  *));
00069 extern int  gsm_option  GSM_P((gsm, int, int *));
00070 
00071 extern void gsm_encode  GSM_P((gsm, gsm_signal *, gsm_byte  *));
00072 extern int  gsm_decode  GSM_P((gsm, gsm_byte   *, gsm_signal *));
00073 
00074 extern int  gsm_explode GSM_P((gsm, gsm_byte   *, gsm_signal *));
00075 extern void gsm_implode GSM_P((gsm, gsm_signal *, gsm_byte   *));

00077 #undef  GSM_P
